Key Match Events: Ja Morant had a solid outing against the Rockets but even he had his lowlights.
The game looked out of reach from the third quarter onwards despite Memphis' best efforts to make a comeback.
Pre-Game Insights: Ja Morant and Co. were quick out of the gates on offense, dropping 38 points in the first quarter.
Post-Match Reflections: Ja Morant had 24 points, two assists and six turnovers with one foul on 8-17 from the field, 2-4 from 3-point range and 6 of 9 from the free throw line.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rockets blew a 12-point lead and won 128-108 after an underwhelming second-half performance.
The Rockets' ball pressure on defense made it difficult for the All-Star to find his spots as the game progressed.
Others: The Grizzlies gained some separation in the second quarter thanks to Morant's burst, giving them a 46-40 lead.
The Rockets also did an excellent job of cutting down his passing lanes, restricting him to two assists and forcing six turnovers.
